idCitation.otherCitDet: Citation: Minnesota Population Center. Integrated Public Use Microdata Series, International: Version 6.2 [Machine-readable database]. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota, 2013.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: ENUTS2 identifies the Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics (NUTS) within Europe. It is a standard administrative division of the European Union, and was developed by the EU. The European Free Trade Association extends the NUTS system to several additional countries outside of the EU, and they are also incorporated into this variable. NUTS2 identifies the secondary territorial units within countries. Where officially-defined geographical units have populations less than 20,000, they have been combined with neighboring geographical units to create units with populations greater than 20,000.

Consts.useLimit: IPUMS International data are available free of charge, but their use imposes responsibilities upon the user. To access the data, a prospective user must submit an electronic authorization form identifying the user by name, electronic address, and institutional affiliation. All persons are granted a limited license to use and distribute this documentation and the available data, subject to the legal constraints listed below.IPUMS International boundary data are intended for use as visual representation and statistical analysis. The boundaries do not necessarily reflect exact political delineations.

LegConsts.useLimit: Authorization to use IPUMS International data constitutes a legal binding agreement between the applicant, the applicant's institution, the University of Minnesota, and the relevant official statistical authorities. Submitting false, misleading or fraudulent information constitutes a violation of this agreement. Misusing the data by violating any of the conditions detailed below also constitutes a violation of this agreement and may lead to professional censure, loss of employment, or civil prosecution under relevant national and international laws, and to sanctions against your institution, at the discretion of the University of Minnesota and the official statistical authorities.
LegConsts.othConsts: USAGE LICENCE: 1. User agrees to receive occasional email messages. 2. Data must not be redistributed without authorization. 3. Data are intended only for scholarly research and educational purposes. 4. Commercial use and redistribution of the data is strictly prohibited. 5. Scholarly publications are permitted, and must be cited appropriately. 6. User agrees to notify ipums@umn.edu regarding possible errors in the map.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics (NUTS 2) for Austria, France, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Portugal, Romania, Slovenia, Spain, and Switzerland.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Funding provided by National Science Foundation and National Institutes of Health. Microdata provided by national statistical offices of the partner countries.

dataExt.exDesc: Geographic extent: Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics (NUTS) within Europe

Consts.useLimit:
Italy: The following ENUTS 2 units were merged due to confidentiality

  • Piemonte (ITC1) and Valle d’Aosta(ITC2) –new ENUTS2 code 1511

  • Botzano-Bozen (ITD1) and Trento (ITD2) –new ENUTS2 code 1521

France: In our map, the overseas territories of France (i.e. Guadeloupe, Martinique, Guyane Reunion) are separate from the mainland. However, the ENUTS document lists them as ENUTS 2 units.

dataLineage.statement: International country boundaries for the world are available from the Office of the Geographer’s Large Scale International Boundary Lines and World Vector Shorelines (LSIB-WVS) polygon file. They are matched with maps available from EUROSTAT and Eurostat methologies and working paper, Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics, NUTS 2010/EU-27, 2011 edition (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat).

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
